profile.name: OSSS Professional Sports Profile
profile.description: Constraint profile for professional leagues. Optimizes for commercial imperatives, broadcast requirements, competitive balance, and high-stakes fairness.

required.rationale: Teams cannot be in two places at once.
Stadiums can only host one match at a time.
Professional athletes require minimum recovery between matches. 48 hours is standard for most professional sports to maintain performance and reduce injury risk.
Professional stadiums host concerts, other sports, and events. Strict availability windows are critical.
Broadcast contracts dictate fixture timing. Violations can breach multi-million dollar agreements.

recommended.rationale: Competitive integrity is paramount. Even small imbalances can affect league standings and playoff qualification worth millions.
Back-to-back fixtures against the same opponent reduce fan interest and broadcast value.
Excessive travel impacts performance, increases costs, and affects recovery time.
Extreme travel can compromise competitive fairness and player welfare, even in professional contexts.
Professional matches require peak performance. Multiple games per day are generally prohibited except in special tournament formats.

metadata.adoptionImpact: Professional leagues gain transparent, auditable schedules with explicit commercial and competitive constraints
